intro: Psathura sechellarum, commonly known as the Seychelles psathura, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Seychelles. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Conservation efforts are crucial to protect this unique botanical species from threats such as habitat loss and invasive species.
